Adding Assets, Songs, and Charts¶

/mod_assets¶

Much like modders should not touch /source, modders should also not touch /assets. Instead, modders should add mod assets under /mod_assets (obviously). The following sections will cover different folders under /mod_assets.

Folder Structure¶

Assets for any mod should be put under a folder of the same name as the mod’s class name. For example, a .json chart for the song example-song for ExampleMod should be put under /mod_assets/data/ExampleMod/example-song/example-song.json.

/data¶

All of a mod’s charts should be stored here.

/weeks¶

All of a mod’s song assets should be stored here.

/songs¶

All of a mod’s music files should be stored here.

/shared¶

This folder is reserved for the Groovin’ framework.

/preload¶

The /preload folder contains the same structure as its parent folder, /mod_assets, but all assets under it are pre-loaded and, in-game, accessed through the root instead of /preload. For example, an image in /mod_assets/preload/images/image.png should be accessed in-game with /mod_assets/images/image.png.
